intro: Aster poliothamnus, commonly known as the white aster, is a herbaceous perennial native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous root system. The plant features upright, branching stems covered in fine hairs, and its leaves are lance-shaped with serrated edges. It produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the late summer and early fall. Aster poliothamnus thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and meadows.
